wikipedia_page.main: John Beech Austin (17 July 1917 – 12 January 2012) was a British Royal Air Force (RAF) pilot during the Second World War. He was one of the RAF's longest-serving special duties pilots, dropping agents and supplies to Resistance movements in eight countries in occupied Europe.

response: *John Beech Austin (1917–2012), British aviator in World War II
* John Beech Austin, Squadron Leader in both the RAF and the SOE.
